main event: A circular and slow-moving object was observed on radar traveling at high altitude before disappearing from the scope.
interesting points: The object appeared to change in size during observation., The sighting lasted for 3-5 seconds., The conclusion drawn was that it was probably a meteor., The object was classified as being yellow-orange in color and trailing flame in another report., The sighting location was pinpointed at coordinates 37-00N 173-30W in the Pacific Ocean.
witness description: observed on radar scope, no specific eyewitnesses mentioned
